data.title: Spanish School in Salamanca
data.meta_description: Leading Spanish school in Salamanca located in the historic centre of the enchanting World Heritage city. Learn spanish in Salamanca. Join us!
data.text:
We are proud to say that our Spanish School in Salamanca conserves the student spirit of many centuries, as Salamanca is considered the greatest university city in Spain. And by right, as Salamanca is home to the oldest university in the country. Founded in 1218, the University of Salamanca brought together the most educated and cultured people from the entire Peninsula. Since then, the city of Salamanca has been famous for its passion for its knowledge, open-mindedness, and great student life. Learn Spanish in Salamanca, a magical city

Estudio Sampere is the best Spanish school in Salamanca!

Founded in 1992, Estudio Sampere is the leading Spanish school in Salamanca. For almost 30 years it has maintained its traditions and teaching philosophy. As a result, it is the top option for individual students and university groups.

Our Spanish school in Salamanca is located in a modern building in the historic part of the city of Salamanca, just a few steps away from the Plaza Mayor (The Main Square). It is a quiet area, but very close to the main city attractions.

What will you find here?

Our Spanish language school in Salamanca features a very friendly environment. Thanks to its medium size, every student is surrounded by warmth and care. Students can contact their teachers, Head of Studies, or administrative staff at any time.

Cuesta de San Blas, s/n, Salamanca, 37002 +34 92 326 22 18 salamanca@sampere.com

Location

Located in the heart of the city of Salamanca, just a 5-minute walk away from the Plaza Mayor, other places of interest and shopping areas.

Open on map

School facilities

A modern building, seven comfortable classrooms equipped with digital white-boards, a student lounge, and a multi-use room for cultural activities.

Other services

A varied cultural program every week, full-day excursions on weekends, visits to museums and places of interest. Different types of accommodation. Translation and interpreting services if needed.

What about our Spanish teachers?

The teachers of our Spanish school in Salamanca will take care of you and your Spanish during the whole stay. They know (and love!) their city and have many unique resources to make you fall in love with Salamanca, too!

All our teachers in Salamanca are native Spanish speakers and experts in the Spanish Language. They have a degree in history, translation or humanities, and a master’s degree or a special course in teaching Spanish as a Foreign Language.

Five things you certainly don’t expect from our Spanish school in Salamanca:

Thebuilding of our Spanish school in Salamanca previously housed the Radio and Television studio of Castilla y Leon! There is actually a soundproofed classroom that was used for recordings.

Located on Cuesta San Blas, the building doesn’t have an address number, in view of its popularity. It is true that we do have difficulties in receiving snail mail though… :)

All the facades in Salamanca look the same, as they were made of the same stone from Villamayor, which had a golden hue. This is the reason behind Salamanca being often referred to as “The Golden City”, and actually, all the new buildings under construction in the historic center of Salamanca are required to use the same stone in their facades by law, in order to preserve the aesthetics of the city.

Our Spanish School in Salamanca offers some cultural activities that you will be able to find neither in other schools nor in other cities. Where else would you visit the Automobile History Museum or the guitar factory, and have the possibility of trying to make a real Spanish guitar?

Salamanca celebrates a local holiday on Easter Monday. This festival is called El Lunes de Aguas (Water Monday). The locals gather on the riverbank to celebrate it together. The origin of this festival is very peculiar, so please check our blog to learn more about it.
